param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: To start packet tracing with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP PUT command on the packet tracing resource URI.
Packet capturing cannot run in promiscuous mode. Only packets that are destined for the configured interface are captured.

Packet capturing can be started only after the existing PCAP file is cleared. If the PCAP file is not 0 bytes, then perform the clear operation first. Otherwise, this operation results in an error. For details about how to clear the existing PCAP file, see Clearing the packet tracing PCAP file.
Only a single packet trace operation can be running at any time.

request.doc: PUT https://{appliance_hostname}/isam/packet_tracing PUT_DATA: { "enable":"true", "filter":"packet tracing filter", "interface":"interface label (eg: 1.1)", "max_size":"maximum PCAP file size (in MB)", "snaplen":"maximum data for each frame (in bytes)", "max_files":"maximum rollover files" }

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: enable
param.doc: Indicates that packet tracing is started.

param.name: filter
param.doc: The filter rule for the tracing, conforming to the PCAP filtering syntax. If not specified then no filter will be used.

param.name: interface
param.doc: The name of the interface to enable packet tracing on. Note: If no value is specified for this parameter, packet tracing is enabled for all interfaces.

param.name: max_size
param.doc: The maximum size (in MB) of the output trace file. The value must be larger than 0. If not specified, the maximum size is set to half the remaining disk size.

param.name: snaplen
param.doc: The maximum amount of data (in bytes) to be collected for each frame. The value can be set as 0 - 65535. If not specified, the default of 65535 is used.

param.name: max_files
param.doc: The maximum number of rollover files. This value can be set as 0 - 99. Once the maximum number of files is reached the utility will begin overwriting the oldest files. If the value is set as 0 or not specified, rollover will be disabled and tracing will stop once the maximum file size is reached.
